newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, July 15 - Santa Fe - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 29 ft. 6 in at access channel. Diamante - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 29 ft. 06 in. at passage KM 520. San Lorenzo - Seven vessels berthed of which 1 loading sbmp, 2 loading sbm, 2 loading sorghum, 1 loading sbo, 1 loading soya. 3 Vessels in roads, 37 due at 6 terminals during the coming week. The forecast indates that the draft is rising about 0.05 metres during next week. Pasa berth draft - 23 ft. 07 in. fw. Rosario - 10 Vessels berthed of which 3 discharging fertiliser, 2 loading fruit, 1 on orders, 2 loading maize, 1 loading sorghum, 1 discharging steel billets. No vessels in roads, 13 due during the coming week. The forecast indicates that the draft is rising approx. 0.05 metres during next week.

Villa Constitucion - No vessels berthed, none in roads, 1 due. Elevor berths - Max. draft 22 ft. 00 in. fw. Dredging in the access channel to Villa Constitucion is planned to commence at the end of September 1997. Work should be completed by the beginning of November 1997. The goal is to leave the access channel with a draft of 7 metres at zero, which added to the average water height of 2 metres, accepting fluctuations, the draft should be approx. 9.12 metres. San Nicolas - Six vessels berthed of which 1 loading steel products, 1 discharging iron ore, 1 discharging steel products, 1 loading cast iron, 1 discharging slabs, 1 discharging coal. 4 Vessels in roads, 8 due during the coming week. The forecast indicates that the draft is rising about 0.05 metres during next week.

San Pedro - No vessels berthed, none in roads, 2 due. San Lorenzo, Rosario, San Nicolas, San Pedro - Max. recommended draft 32 ft. 06 in./33 ft. fw high tide. Buenos Aires - 18 Vessels in port, 28 due during the coming week. Max. recommended draft 31 ft. 06 in. fw high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Dock Sud - Max. recommended draft 28/29 ft. fw. high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Necochea - Five vessels berthed of which 2 loading maize, 1 discharging urea, 1 loading wheat, 1 loading sfmp. 12 Vessels in roads, 5 due during the coming week. Max recommended draft 40 ft. bw. Bahia Blanca - Four vessels berthed of which 2 loading maize, 1 discharging barley, 1 discharging crude. 3 Vessels in roads, 10 due during the coming week. Draft depends on each berth.

BRAZIL, July 15 - Vitoria - Vessels berthed, 1 cellulose loader, 1 bulk soya loader, 2 granite loaders, 1 bulk bauxite discharger, 1 container/general cargo discharger/loader. Tubarao - 1 Iron ore loader, 1 fuel discharger. Praia Mole - 3 Steel products loaders. Portocel - 1 Cellulose loader. Ubu - 1 Iron ore loader. Nine vessels waiting in roads. Santos - Vessels berthed, 4 full container loaders/dischargers, 1 container loader, 1 container discharger, 1 bulk cement, 2 bulk chemical products dischargers, 1 bulk fertiliser discharger, 1 bulk fertiliser loader, 9 sugar loaders, 1 fresh fruit loader, 1 bulk sulphur loader, 1 general cargo loader, 1 general cargo/container loader/discharger, 1 general cargo/bulk juice loader/discharger, 1 vehicles loader, 1 lpg discharger, 1 bulk wheat discharger, 1 bulk diesel oil loader, 1 bulk salt loader, 1 frozen cargo loader, 1 bulk pellets loader. 33 Vessels waiting in roads, 96 due during next 7 days.

Private terminals - Cosipa - 1 Iron ore discharger, 1 steel products loader, 1 steel products discharger, 1 bulk coal discharger. Ultrafertil - 1 Bulk fertiliser discharger. Rio de Janeiro - Vessels berthed, 1 general cargo/steel products discharger, 1 paper discharger, 2 general cargo dischargers, 1 steel products discharger, 2 wheat dischargers, 1 vehicle discharger, 1 general cargo/steel products loader, 1 general cargo loader, 1 steel products loader. Tecon - 1 Vessel. 37 Vessels due during next 7 days. Sao Sebastiao - Vessels berthed - Tebar - 2 Vessels, 3 due during next 7 days. Paranagua - Vessels berthed - 3 Fertiliser dischargers, 4 general cargo dischargers, 2 sugar loaders, 2 pellets loaders, 1 soya loader, 5 general cargo loaders. 30 Vessels waiting in roads of which for loading, 10 sugar, 5 pellets, 2 general cargo, 4 soya. For discharging, 8 fertiliser, 1 general cargo. 28 Vessels due during next 7 days.

Salvador - Negotiations between the Salvador private port operators and the unions of casual port labour are deadlocked again. Consequently, those vessels whose operations depend on terminal handling services which use to be supplied by the Salvador Dock Co. remain idle. Vessels which do not require Dock Co. services such as container and ro-ro vessels, are reportedly operating normally.

CHILE, July 14 - Arica - Two vessels in terminal, 4 berths vacant. 9 Vessels due during the week, port working normally. Iquique - Four vessels berthed, 2 due during the week, 16 others due. Antofagasta - Six vessels berthed, 1 berth available. 18 Vessels due during the week for loading and discharging concentrates, bulk copper, containers and general cargo. Valparaiso - Two vessels berthed working normally, 7 berths vacant. 1 Berth out of service due to enlargent of pier 2 until April 1998. 12 Vessels due during the week. San Antonio - Six vessels operating, 3 berths vacant. 23 Vessels due during the week, working normally. Conception Bay ports - Talcahuano - One vessel berthed, 4 due, none waiting in roads.

San Vicente - Three vessels berthed, working normally. 5 Vessels due during the week. Navy pier (Molo 500) - 1 Vessel berthed, 1 berth vacant, no vessels due. Steel pier - 1 Vessel berthed, 1 due. Coronel pier - 2 Vessels berthed in terminal, 1 due. Oil terminal - 1 Vessel in terminal, no vessels due. Lirquen - Six vessels berthed, working normally. 2 Vessels due during the week. Penco - One vessel in terminal, none due. Puerto Montt - Two vessels in port, 5 due during the week. Punta Arenas - Four vessels berthed in terminal, 6 due during the week.

VENEZUELA, July 14 - Puerto Cabello - Four vessels anchored, 10 berthed of which 6 grain cargo, 2 general cargo, 1 bulk cargo, 1 container vessel. Piers 1 and 2 closed. Guanta - Vessels berthed 1 general cargo, 1 fishing vessel. July 15 - Puerto Ordaz - Two vessels loading of which 1 iron ore, 1 iron pellets, 3 due. Palua - One vessel loading/discharging generals, 1 due. San Felix - One vessel loading/discharging generals. Boca Grande - One vessel due. Venalum - Two vessels loading aluminium, 2 due. Matanzas - Three vessels loading steel products, 5 due. Mile 178 - Three vessels waiting at anchorage to load/discharge. Interalumina - One vessel due. Alcasa - Three vessels due. Orinoco river - Dredgers in position as follows, Hang Jun anchored betwwen mile 35 and 40, Rio Orinoco anchored between mile 53 and 54, Guayana anchored at mile 178.

Puerto Cabello - 14 Vessels operating of which 11 loading/discharging general cargo, 3 discharging sugar. 12 Vessels due, 1 under repair. Guanta - One vessel loading/discharging generals, 3 due. La Guaira - Two vessels loading/discharging generals, 5 due, 1 passenger vessel, 3 under repair. Amuay - One vessel waiting at anchorage to load, 1 loading refined products. Cardon - Two vessels waiting at anchorage to load, 1 loading refined products. Guaranao - One vessel waiting at anchorage to load/discharge, 1 loading/discharging generals. Maracaibo - No information received. All ports are working normally.
